intro: Cryptandra polyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptandra, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat. Cryptandra polyclada is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry environments.
